alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Logan; Montgomery; Scott; Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 21 at 10:43PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Logan, southwestern Johnson, southeastern Scott, western Yell and Montgomery Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1043 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ozark to near Cardiff to near Opal. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clarksville... Paris... Danville... Mount Ida... Lamar... Magazine... Knoxville... Subiaco... Hartman... Norman... Oden... Scranton... Blue Mountain... Hoyt... Midway in Logan County... Mauldin... Albert Pike Recreation Area... Muddy Creek WMA... Stonehouse Recreation Area... Mimosa... This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 45 and 63. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for central and western Arkansas.
